headline: Socialist Wins Support Of Spanish Parliament
abstract: The Socialist leader won approval from Parliament and will now run a fragile grouping of left-leaning parties whose survival may hinge on the separatist dispute in Catalonia.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the Socialist party in Spain, Pedro Sánchez, was narrowly approved as prime minister by Parliament on Tuesday, clearing his way to form the country’s first coalition government since the return to democracy in the 1970s.
